meanings.definition: To certify or attest to the authenticity of a document by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: The notary will notarise the contract to make it official.
meanings.sent2: It is important to notarise legal documents to ensure their validity.
meanings.sent3: The notary accidentally notarised the wrong page, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her signature notarised the agreement, sealing the deal.
meanings.sent5: The notary's stamp notarised the will, confirming its authenticity.

meanings.definition: To witness or verify the signing of a document by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: The notary will notarise the deed once all parties have signed.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to notarise the form after signing it.
meanings.sent3: The notary had to notarise the document in a hurry before the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The notary's job is to notarise signatures to prevent fraud.
meanings.sent5: He asked the notary to notarise his will, ensuring it was properly executed.
